document_data.name: Foharell
document_data.mainbody:
'''Foharell''' was a sea captain and a worshiper of [[Umberlee]] who prayed at the [[Water Queen's House]] in [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''Here to make an offering to Umberlee as well, eh? They say it's good luck to placate the Bitch Queen after a drowning.''|Captain Foharell}}
document_data.Description: Foharell was a [[dwarf|dwarvish]] man with a charcoal gray skin tone, extremely uncommon among [[gold dwarves]] like he. The captain had cold gray eyes, bushy white beard and kept his head clean-shaven. Foharell wore a simple [[leather armor]].
document_data.History: ''Circa'' the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, during the [[Absolute crisis]], Captain Foharell frequented the Water Queen's House, uttering prayers to her goddess. He was at the temple shortly after one of its [[priestess]]es, [[Holli Dylford]], drowned whilst swimming in the [[Gray Harbor]]. Foharell thought it to be a good luck to appease the goddess after a drowning.
